lead_paragraph: United Nations officials were cautious about the prospect of airdrops, saying that they would need the consent of the Syrian government.

byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce reported from Geneva, and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and RICK GLADSTONE

headline.print_headline: U.N. Dims Hope of Imminent Airdrops in Syria
headline.main: U.N. Plans No Imminent Airdrops of Aid in Syria, Despite Expired Deadline

snippet: United Nations officials were cautious about the prospect of airdrops, saying that they would need the consent of the Syrian government.
abstract: United Nations lowers any chance of immediate airdrops bearing aid to Syrian civilians trapped by war, in spite of expired deadline, saying it would need consent of Syrian government for security reasons.
